reviews.review_msg: loved his class. the best prof i ever had! could be a role model for many others!
Awesome instructor. Full of passion and always ready to help. Knows his material and unintentionally funny. Can't ask more!

Probably the worst class I have taken at SFU. I took this course online and thought it would be a GPA booster but it definitely wasn't! This course took up more time than my three third year classes. TM was Sarah Sparks and she handed back assignments late constantly claiming she was "sick". I would not recommend this class to anyone!

Lucas is a great prof. He's so funny which makes his lectures fun to go to. I actually looked forward to going to this class. The readings are tough to understand sometimes, so definitely go to lecture because he clears them up and will tell you what to expect on the exams. Midterm was super easy!!

Lucas is an awesome prof. If you're really into gender studies he gives great info,lecture,discussion.  If you're just taking this class for extra credit then he's also good because he makes a point of including everyone even if gender studies is new to you.
Lectures were great and fun. Easy breakdown of papers in powerpoints and lectures, but have to attend to get full experience. Twitter assignment was a joke, though. My TA in this course was terrible.

Lucas is super passionate about what he teaches, and is ALWAYS open to other people's opinions and encourages discussion. Take really good notes during his lectures because what he says is what's on the exams. Difficult course because it questions a lot of "normal" things, but Lucas makes it interesting and engaging!
A wonderful professor who really cares about her students.  She wants the best for everyone and is really accommodating to your needs.

This was by far the worst class ever. The final was a complete joke... had to memorize 50 definitions and only 5 popped up on the exam. Had to prepare 14 essay outlines and only 2 popped up on exam. HATED THIS CLASS. Assignments were ok the one on drag queens was challenging.

Not tech savvy, which was unfortunate considering this was an online course. Minimal instruction was given on exams, but weekly assignments were fine. As a student who struggles with open endedness, this was a learning experience for me for sure but not a terrible one. Interesting readings.
She was okay, she was pretty easy to get a hold of, and the assignments were laid out clearly. As long as you do the reading and watch the lectures you will do fine.
Professor was extremely blunt in giving feed back, and does so in such a way that makes you feel stupid. Her lectures overall engaging and interesting, the let down with the class is the professor.

Would not describe the criteria for assignments effectively. Lectures were robotic and not well structured. Particular about how students follow instructions pertaining to group discussions. Grades assignments harshly and slow. Expect to get grades back at end of the semester. Feedback is unhelpful and vague. Frequently cancelled class the day of

Was afraid to take her class due to the ratings I saw however she was very understanding along with her TA's about student's difficulties due to the pandemic and if needed was kind enough to be flexible.

A personal issue arose for her mid-semester so our only interactions were her pre-recorded lectures, but she seemed pretty chill. Her lectures aren't super connected to the readings, but if you have any basic knowledge of intersectional feminism, this class is a breeze. 1 midterm 1 final 3 in-class debates & tutorials account for your whole grade

As it is a pandemic, I would have liked a little more compassion from Dr. Patterson. I felt that we were kinda being bombarded with work. Additionally, the instructions on assignments were NEVER clear, making it difficult to understand what we were even supposed to do.
I had literally zero contact with her the entire term, poor communication.
